means: 不明智的，不可取的，不妥当的

sentence.Network_en: For three days, it was inadvisable to leave the harbour.
sentence.Network_cn: 三天之内最好不要驶离海港。

sentence.Network_en: It is inadvisable to bring children on this trip.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次旅行带孩子不妥当。

sentence.Network_en: It was thought highly inadvisable for young women to go there alone.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们认为年轻女子独自去那里是极不妥当的.

list.abs: an unnecessary and inadvisable action ., 没有必要而且失策的行动.

entry.tran: 不明智的;不可取的;失策的
entry.def: A course of action that is inadvisable should not be carried out because it is not wise or sensible.

example.ex: For three days, it was inadvisable to leave the harbour.
example.tran: 三天之内最好不要驶离海港。

means.word_mean: 1. not prudent or wise; not recommended;
